intro: Peperomia vidaliana, commonly known as the Yellow-veined Peperomia, is a compact, evergreen shrub native to South America. It features thick, waxy leaves that are typically oval to heart-shaped, with distinctive yellow or white veins. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually greenish-white in color. It thrives in bright, indirect light and prefers well-draining soil. Peperomia vidaliana is a popular choice for indoor gardening due to its low maintenance and attractive foliage.
